channel.title: Error Message Please Help {Solved}
channel.description:
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/StringBuilder at Bot. <clinit><Bot.java:104> Press any key to continue...[/code]
I get then when I try to run the Moparbatch file, and when I try to run a server I get this...
[img]http://img177.imageshack.us/img177/5899/erroria1.png[/img]
Please, someone help me. It was working then I downloaded the latest version of Java and now it doesn't work. I even unistalled the new version and still doesn't work. Someone please help.
Thanks -Ryu[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 07:29:47 PM[/size][hr]Please, someone, I really need help.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 07:43:20 PM[/size][hr]Please someone, doesn't anyone have any idea.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 08:16:29 PM[/size][hr]I found out how, in case someone wants to know how in the furture,
1. Go to Add/Remove Programs in the Control Panel 2. Uninstall J2SE Developement Kid 5.0 Update 6, and J2SE Runtime Environment 5.0 Update 6 3. Go [url=http://java.sun.com/j2ee/1.4/download.html]here[/url] and download JDK 5.0 and install it.

item.title: Error Message Please Help {Solved}
item.dc:creator: @Jack_coderz Jack coderz
item.description:
@Jack_coderz wrote:

Java 5.0? that is old but go to >java.com>download>view all java downloads.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Message Please Help {Solved}
item.dc:creator: @xRYUx xRYUx
item.description:
@xRYUx wrote:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/StringBuilder at Bot. <clinit><Bot.java:104> Press any key to continue...

I get then when I try to run the Moparbatch file, and when I try to run a server I get this…

Please, someone help me. It was working then I downloaded the latest version of Java and now it doesn’t work. I even unistalled the new version and still doesn’t work. Someone please help.

Thanks
-Ryu[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 07:29:47 PM[/size][hr]Please, someone, I really need help.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 07:43:20 PM[/size][hr]Please someone, doesn’t anyone have any idea.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 12, 2006, 08:16:29 PM[/size][hr]I found out how, in case someone wants to know how in the furture,

  1. Go to Add/Remove Programs in the Control Panel
  2. Uninstall J2SE Developement Kid 5.0 Update 6, and J2SE Runtime Environment 5.0 Update 6
  3. Go here and download JDK 5.0 and install it.

Read full topic
